Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a variety of land habitats, such as playgrounds, gardens, and forests, as well as water habitats, like ponds and streams, with appropriate detail.
The student can include and accurately label different plants found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can include and accurately label different animals found in each habitat, like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can make comparisons by effectively drawing similar and different living things in various habitats, noting relationships and differences.
The student can identify and draw patterns in the natural world, showing how different habitats support different kinds of living things with clear logical reasoning.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally miss labeling a plant or animal, but this occurs rarely and typically does not indicate a misunderstanding.
The student might sometimes choose less common examples or mix detailed representation with simpler sketches, yet overall, they maintain accuracy in representation.
